definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: But the cafeteria is doing its best to force me to be a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 但是飯堂竭力在強迫我成爲一名素食主義者。

sentences.english: Get into a Kobe-related discussion in your school's lunchroom.
sentences.chinese: 或者在你學校的飯堂裏討論關於科比的話題。

sentences.english: Are your staff happy with the canteen, do you think?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得你的員工對飯堂滿意嗎？

sentences.english: Yesterday I encountered my friend Zhang Kai in the canteen, and we enjoyed the meal together.
sentences.chinese: 昨天在飯堂喫飯遇見張凱，便坐下來一起用餐。

sentences.english: Public bus fees have not been available, had a trip to the canteen.
sentences.chinese: 公巴費還沒有着落，只好往飯堂跑一趟。

sentences.english: This dining hall is for the use of tepainfulnessrs.
sentences.chinese: 這個飯堂是供西賓操縱的。

sentences.english: He was responsible for cooking in the cafeteria.
sentences.chinese: 他在飯堂是負責紅案這項工作的。

sentences.english: I washed dishes in the school cafeteria.
One semester must register, the number of meals in the canteen are few.
sentences.chinese: 一個學期算下來，在飯堂喫飯的次數寥寥無幾。

sentences.english: We will put the box in canteen during lunch time.
sentences.chinese: 午飯時間捐款箱會放在飯堂。

sentences.english: The canteen food is poor, so we have become a loyal fan of instant noodle.
sentences.chinese: 飯堂的飯菜很差，於是我們都成了方便麪的忠實粉絲。

definition: the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to go/take out (relates to food bought at a restaurant)
